The area between 0 and 24 miles will remain reserved for local mayote fishing.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. — This agreement allows seychelles-flaunder vessels to access mayot waters and their resources. The territory of Mayot acquired the status of the EU's Outermost Region in January 2014. As a result of status, the Mayot Exclusive Economic Zone is subject to the provisions of the EU Treaties. The conservation of mayote's marine living resources under the Common Fisheries Policy is an exclusive competence of the EU.  For this reason, the existing bilateral agreement between Mayote and seychelles – previously existing – must now be re-established by the EU. Our position on the EU's competences in this area is well known – we are against it. However, this report only aims to extend under the new conditions the same agreement previously existing, which allows a limited number of Seychelles vessels to fish in mayan waters migratory species, offering some considerations aimed at supporting the sustainable development of the fisheries sector in Mayot – consisting primarily of artisanal fleet. Which is why we have nothing to do with this agreement.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. — This recommendation refers to the agreement with seychelles, allowing their vessels to fish in the waters of the outermost region of Mayotte. My vote will abstain because it is not clear what the possible advantage is between local shipowners in EU jurisdiction and the other party.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: Writing. — I am voting in favour of the EU-Seychelles Agreement on access for fishing vessels to Mayotte waters, because this agreement will respect fisheries policy for the conservation of water resources.

name: Francisco de Paula GAMBUS MILLET
text: in writing. — The territory of Mayotte became an outermost region of the EU on 1 January 2014. Consequently, Mayotte's exclusive economic zone is now an integral part of the union's waters. The EU is therefore responsible for managing its fisheries resources. Given the geographical proximity of Mayotte and the Seychelles, prior to Mayotte's change in status, relations between European and Seychelles fishing vessels with Mayotte were governed by a private agreement allowing some thirty vessels in total, including eight of the Seychelles, to fish migratory species in the waters of Mayotte, while allowing the development of Mayotte fishing thanks to the royalties paid directly by shipowners French State services in Mayotte. In view of these circumstances, I voted in favour of allowing a limited number of Seychelles-flagged vessels, which have traditionally fished in the waters of Mayotte, to continue fishing in the Mayotte EEZ in accordance with the rules of the common fisheries policy.

name: Nathan GILL
text: in writing. — Not only has the EU managed to strip our own waters of fish stocks (not to mention discarding thousands of tons of perfectly healthy fish), but it is now seeking to do the same throughout the rest of the world. By giving money to the wealthy political class of the Seychelles, in order to get fishing rights from the poor fishermen, the EU is just participating in neocolonial exploitation.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. - I voted in favour of the Cadec report because I believe the EU-Seychelles agreement is an important tool for increasing development opportunities for Mayotte and the Seychelles. Crucial in gaining my support was the fact that the agreement complies with the rules of the common fisheries policy on preserving resources.

name: Michela GIUFFRIDA
text: in writing. — (IT) I voted in favour of this agreement because it seems normal and natural that neighbouring islands in the Indian Ocean should reach trade agreements on fisheries which will benefit the interests of all the parties involved.  Of course, in this case it seems strange that Mayotte's negotiating power, which is geographically so far away, should be entrusted to the European Union. Yet it is Mayotte himself who gives the Eu ropean Union the opportunity to conclude agreements in the Indian Ocean and to establish relations with important partners such as the Seychelles. The possibility of Seychelles vessels being able to fish in Mayotte waters certainly brings advantages to the latter, but it must be the Seychelles' own to determine this. Despite the fact that in this case it is represented by the European Union and France, to which it belongs, we must not underestimate or ignore for a second time, we must not take due account of the population, the fishermen and the social partners on the island involved in the agreement. That the EU has exclusive responsibility for species conservation must not mean loss of voice for local communities.

name: Sylvie GODDYN
text: In writing. — I will vote for the access of Seychelles fishing vessels to the waters and biological resources of Mayotte. In fact, this agreement formalizes a historical habit of Seychelles vessels, even if it is an exception by allowing a third country to fish in French waters. However, it concerns only a limited number of Seychelles-flagged vessels, namely 8 tuna vessels and 2 supply ships. In addition, shipowners pay royalties redistributed to Mayotte, which will increase in 6 years from 110 euros to 125 euros per tonne caught. These fees will be used to develop the port infrastructure of Mayotte, which needs it to develop.  However, as the rapporteur has pointed out, it is regrettable that local fishing in Mahorese is only entitled to a reserved area of 0 to 24 miles from the coast, compared to 24 to 100 miles for Seychelles vessels.  It is to be hoped that the development of Mayotte's port infrastructure will allow the Mahorese fishery to eventually replace the Seychelles fishery. It is on this point that we will judge the device in the mid-term review, in three years' time.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. — We voted in favour of this Recommendation which endorses the Agreement between the EU and the Republic of Seychelles, as it benefits both sides, is positive for the economic development of Mayotte and seychelles, and respects the rules of the Common Fisheries Policy and the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission (CAOI) on resource protection. This Agreement will allow the continuation of a traditional economic activity in that region, taking into account criteria of good management and protection of resources. It will also promote the local economy and infrastructure development of the fishing sector on the island of Mayotte and the Republic of Seychelles and strengthen good relations between the latter and the EU.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. — I voted in favour of the EU-Seychelles agreement on access for fishing vessels to the waters of Mayotte because this agreement is important in relation to the migratory nature of the fish resource, and it will help to maintain the privileged relations between the European Union and the Republic of the Seychelles.

name: Ian HUDGHTON
text: in writing. — Mayotte’s entry into the EU as an overseas department of France has resulted in anomalies in the current access regime to their territorial waters. This report seeks to rectify the situation and I voted in favour.

name: Pablo IGLESIAS
text: in writing. - We voted in favour of this Recommendation which endorses the Agreement between the EU and the Republic of Seychelles, as it benefits both sides, is positive for the economic development of Mayotte and seychelles, and respects the rules of the Common Fisheries Policy and the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission (CAOI) on resource protection. This Agreement will allow the continuation of a traditional economic activity in that region, taking into account criteria of good management and protection of resources. It will also promote the local economy and infrastructure development of the fishing sector on the island of Mayotte and the Republic of Seychelles and strengthen good relations between the latter and the EU.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. — I voted for a draft legislative resolution on the Council's draft decision on the conclusion of the Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Seysela on the approach of fishing villages, flying the Seychelles flag, waters and marine biological resources of Mayotte, as this decision allows for the continued fishing activities of Seychelles fishing vessels in the area of the Moyottea Exclusive Economic Zone, which constitutes a historical activity, respecting the rules of the EU Common Fisheries Policy. After Mayotte became an ultraperiferous region of the European Union on 1 January 2014, the strategic importance of this Agreement leads to maintaining preferential relations between the European Union and the Republic of the Seysela. In fact, I believe that these activities should be carried out in addition to stimulating the development of the Mayotta fishing sector and while preserving the natural resources of the island, and I believe that this way promotes the economic development of Mayott and seysela.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. — I voted in favour of my colleague Alain Cadec's recommendation on the access of Seychelles-flagged fishing vessels to the waters of Mayotte, a department that has been an integral part of the European Union since 1 January 2014. I believe that this agreement should benefit both sides and I welcome the commitment that the royalties will be paid in full for the development of local fisheries in Mahorese.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. — I voted in favour of this report on the agreement between the European Union and Seychelles on the access of Seychelles-flagged fishing vessels to the waters and marine biological resources of Mayotte, under the jurisdiction of the European Union. The agreement provides for access to part of the Exclusive Economic Zone of Mayotte for 8 fishing vessels and two Seychellois supply vessels, in accordance with the rules of the Common Fisheries Policy. The royalties paid by the shipowners will be redistributed to Mayotte to meet the island's sectoral needs.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. — I supported the agreement, as it is beneficial for the economic development of Mayotte and the Seychelles and it complies with the rules of the common fisheries policy with regard to the preservation of resources.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. - (IT) I supported President Cadec's report because I believe that the agreement sets out rules that are beneficial to both the EU and the Seychelles, contributing to economic development in the light of the rules in force on the common fisheries policy and the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission (CTOI). The agreement provides that 8 tuna seiners and 2 Seychelles-flagged support vessels may enter the area between 24 and 100 miles, for a renewable period of 6 years. The area between 0 and 24 miles will continue to be reserved for local fishing in Mayotte.

name: Gilles LEBRETON
text: In writing. "I voted for this project because it preserves the interests of France and its overseas department Mayotte. It limits to eight ships, in accordance with ancient usage, the right of the Republic of Seychelles to come and fish in the waters of Mahor. And it provides that the owners of these ships will pay a fee to France.

name: Javi LÓPEZ
text: in writing. — I am voting in favour of this decision as the Fisheries Agreement with the Seychelles is the most important that the EU has in the Indian Ocean with regard to tuna fishing and, in this case, provides for an access agreement between the two parties so that Seychelles boats can continue fishing in the territory of Mayotte, which has been an ultra-pereric region of the EU since January 2014. The European fisheries sector, through Europech, has expressed its interest in the agreement, as there are European vessels fishing there with a Seychelles flag, but I would like to stress the need for the local population of Mayotte to receive the full benefits of the agreement and also to make fund management transparent and effective.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. — This report concerns the agreement signed between the Republic of the Seychelles and the territory of Mayotte, which acceded to the status of outermost region on 1 January 2014. In doing so, fishing resources in Mayotte's exclusive economic zone became under EU competence, forcing the adapting of old fisheries contracts to the rules of the common fisheries policy. Due to the proximity between the Seychelles and Mayotte, a limited number of Seychelles boats had traditionally fished in the waters of Mayotte. The agreement allows this practice to continue, in accordance with European fishing rules. As a result, I voted in favour.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: in writing. — Relations between the European Union and the Republic of Seychelles on fisheries are governed by a partnership agreement in the sustainable fisheries sector which entered into force on 10 May 2003 and has been renewed twice since then.  This access agreement is of strategic importance, given the migratory nature of tuna resources and the privileged relations maintained by the European Union with the Republic of Seychelles can be preserved. Since this Agreement benefits both sides, is positive for the economic development of Mayotte and the Seychelles, and respects the rules of the Common Fisheries Policy and the IAOC on the protection of resources, I voted in favour of this project.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: Written. — The Agreement between the European Union and the Seyseles, signed in April 2014, will establish a six-year period for Seysele-flagged vessels that will be able to fish in an area of 24 to 100 nautical miles off the coast of Mayotta, leaving the area from the coast up to 24 nautical miles as an exclusive area for the Mayotte population.  The amounts that fishery owners will be required to pay are 110 euros per tonne for the first year of the agreement, 115 euros per tonne for the second and third years, 120 euros for the fourth and fifth and 125 euros per tonne for the sixth year of the agreement. The Republic of France will raise these funds and allocate them to their overseas territory of Mayotte.   I supported the report on the Agreement between the European Union and the Seysela on the access of fishing vessels sailing the waters of Mayotte, as the funds raised will help local people and stimulate infrastructure development.  The implementation of the agreement allows for a mid-term review of the impact of the agreement and the abolition of it if human rights violations and the rule of law occur. These rules will allow for a more transparent implementation of the agreement from which both sides will benefit.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: Writing. — Finally, the European Union will solve its long-standing problem. The waters belong to the EU. I voted in favour. There will now be no obstacles to concluding an agreement.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: Writing. — I am voting in favour of the Recommendation because I believe that the present Agreement favours both sides, while at the same time the Agreement contributes to the economic development of Mayotte and Seychelles with appropriate respect for the rules of the common fisheries policy and the relevant rules of the Indian Ocean Tonoid Committee (ETIO) as regards the conservation of water resources.

name: David MARTIN
text: in writing. — I voted for this agreement. This access agreement is strategically important in view of the migratory nature of the tuna resource. It also responds to a request from the Republic of the Seychelles for reciprocity in the Sustainable Fisheries Partnership Agreement (SFPA), with an agreement that enables Seychelles vessel owners to fish in European waters. This agreement will help to maintain the privileged relations between the European Union and the Republic of the Seychelles.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. — In favour of the Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Seychelles on the access of vessels flying the flag of seychelles to the waters of Mayotte. This Agreement benefits the economic development of Mayotte and the Seychelles and respects the rules of the Common Fisheries Policy and the CTOI on the conservation of resources

name: Barbara MATERA
text: in writing. — Relations between the EU and the Republic of Seychelles in the fisheries sector are governed by a Partnership Agreement for Sustainable Fisheries (APPS). On 3 April 2014, a new agreement was signed between the parties.  It lays down the terms of access by vessels flying the flag of seychelles to the waters and marine biological resources of Mayotte. I agree with this agreement, because I believe that it sets rules that are beneficial to both parties.  It will help to bring benefits to the economic development of Mayotte and the Seychelles, without underestimating the existing rules on the common fisheries policy.

name: Georg MAYER
text: Writing. — As this agreement, which is currently unique, will boost the economic situation of these third countries, I voted in favour of the recommendation.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. — Relations between the European Union and the Republic of Seychelles in the fisheries sector are governed by a sustainable fisheries partnership agreement. The partnership agreement on sustainable tuna fishing between the European Union and Seychelles entered into force on 10 May 2003 and has been renewed twice since that date. This is the union's most important agreement in the Indian Ocean region, making Seychelles its main partner in that area. This Agreement consists of an access agreement, initialled on 3 April 2014, between the Republic of Seychelles and the European Union on access to the waters and biological resources of Mayote.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. — I voted in favour of the recommendation on the EU-Seychelles agreement because it will benefit Mayotte and the Seychelles and it complies with the rules of the common fisheries policy and the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission. The new agreement adds a new point, which specifies that the Seychelles vessels taking advantage of such an agreement must unload their catch in the port of Victoria, which will lead to the development of the Seychelles fishing and processing industry. The agreement also stresses the importance of resource preservation and the development of local economies.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: In writing. Since 1 January 2014, Mayotte has been part of the European Union as a French outermost region. I therefore welcome the approval of this agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Seychelles authorising access to the waters of Mayotte to Seychelles-flagged fishing vessels. This agreement is crucial because it concerns an exclusive competence of the Union, namely the conservation of the biological resources of the sea within the framework of the Common Fisheries Policy (Article 3 TFUE). The application of this jurisdiction in Mayotte allows for the continuation, within the framework of European standards, of a pre-existing private agreement between the Seychelles fishermen and Mayotte. The island and local fishermen will also benefit from royalties collected from Seychelles fishermen, notably through the improvement of the port infrastructure of The City.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. — The EU-Seychelles Fisheries Agreement on access for fishing vessels to waters of Mayotte is the first of its kind, and it is exceptional in that it grants third-country-flagged vessels the right to fish in European waters. It provides access for eight tuna purse-seine vessels flying the Seychelles flag to an area between 24 miles and 100 miles for a six-year period that can be renewed. The agreement is of strategic importance for the Seychelles and it supplements the existing agreement that we have for EU vessels in Seychelles waters. Therefore, I voted in favour of the Cadec report.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. This agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Seychelles allows Seychelles-flagged fishing vessels to access the waters, and therefore to the marine biological resources, of Mayotte, which fall directly under EU jurisdiction. Thus, since Mayotte became an outermost region of the European Union in 2014, its exclusive economic zone (EEZ) has been part of the EU's waters. It should be noted on the merits that France's national sovereignty is once again being abused. However, in form, this agreement concerns only a very limited number of Seychelles-flagged vessels, which have always been used to fishing in the waters of Mayotte. This is the perpetuation of a historical tradition. In order not to penalise these activities, I voted in favour of this text.

name: Claude MORAES
text: in writing. — The current EU-Seychelles agreement is the EU’s most important agreement in the Indian Ocean, which makes the Seychelles the EU’s leading partner in the region. The renewed agreement benefits both parties in that it is beneficial for the economic development of Mayotte and the Seychelles and it complies with the rules of the common fisheries policy with regard to the preservation of resources.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. — I voted in favour of this text, which allows 10 fishing vessels in the Republic of Seychelles to access the Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) in Mayotte to fish for migratory species. It is a balanced agreement, including clauses that promote local development and reserve the 0 to 24 mile zone for The Mahorese fishery.

name: Alessia Maria MOSCA
text: in writing. — Following the acquisition, since 1 January 2014, of the status of an outermost region of the European Union, the Mayotte Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) is currently an integral part of Union waters and, therefore, it is up to the relevant Community authorities not only to manage fisheries resources, but also to negotiate and monitor any bilateral agreements signed. In this respect, the European Parliament is called upon to give an opinion on this agreement, which in this case can only be favourable to us, as it is beneficial to both parties: it benefits the economic development of Mayotte and the Seychelles and respects the rules of the common fisheries policy and the CTOI on the conservation of resources. Although we do not have specific competence to amend it, we would like today to stress the need to involve the fishermen of Mayotte in the meetings of the Joint Committee set up by this agreement and to ensure their participation at all stages of its implementation, as well as to provide for structural investments and administrative control frameworks that will promote the sustainable development of the fisheries and processing sectors on the island.

name: Alessandra MUSSOLINI
text: in writing. — I am voting in favour of the EU-Seychelles agreement on access for Seychelles vessels to mayotte waters and marine biological resources under EU jurisdiction, in accordance with the rules of the common fisheries policy. This agreement is important both because seychelles are the EU's main partner in the Indian Ocean, but also because of the strategic importance of the migratory nature of tuna stocks. Furthermore, the agreement will only consolidate and maintain the privileged relations that the European Union will have with the Republic of Seychelles.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. — I voted for this Agreement because it benefits both parties, fosters the economic development of Mayotte and the Seychelles and respects the rules of the common fisheries policy and the IOTC rules on resource conservation.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: Writing. — I voted in favour of the agreement. However, the Commission is now called upon to actively support the proposals for improvement mentioned in the report. In particular, the information on the general conservation status of the captive species must be sound in order to continue such an agreement in the future.

name: Younous OMARJEE
text: In writing. The eu-Seychelles fisheries agreement dates back to 2003 and has been renewed twice since then. This report aims to expand access for Seychelles vessels - in this case 8 tuna and two supply ships - in the waters of Mayotte, which have become European waters since the island was rushed in 2014, in accordance with the rules of common fishing policy, while increasing the revenues generated for Mayotte, ranging from EUR 110 to EUR 125 per tonne caught. I voted in favour of this report, which is beneficial to the development of both parties, but especially for Mayotte, who has been granted 24 nautical miles reserved for his fishing.

name: Urmas PAET
text: Writing. — I supported the proposal because it is an important Treaty of the European Union in the Indian Ocean region and, as a result, Seychelles is the main cooperation partner in the region. The agreement supports the economic development of both Mayotte and Seychelles and creates new opportunities for the EU.

name: Rolandas PAKSAS
text: Writing. — I welcome the conclusion of this agreement. It should be noted that this is the first agreement of its kind. In accordance with the provisions of this Operational Agreement, vessels flying the flag of a third country will be authorised to fish in European waters. It should be noted that the agreement will benefit both parties, as well as the economic development of Mayotte and Seychelles. It will promote the development of sustainable and responsible fishing while increasing the value of fishery products. I believe that it is appropriate to provide for the conditions for its suspension in the agreement, especially in cases where human rights, democracy, the rule of law and good governance are violated. In addition, the mid-term review provided for in the agreement will allow an assessment of the usefulness and effectiveness of the agreement.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. — Ladies and gentlemen, given that relations between the European Union and the Republic of Seychelles in the fisheries sector are governed by a Partnership Agreement for Sustainable Fisheries (APPS); Whereas this agreement concerns the access of vessels flying the flag of seychelles to the waters and marine biological resources of Mayotte, whose territory has acquired the status of an outermost region of the European Union; Given that this Agreement allows vessels flying the flag of seychelles to fish for highly migratory species in accordance with the rules of the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission (CTOI), I am therefore voting in favour.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: In writing. — This agreement benefits both parties and will allow a reasoned use of the waters of Mayotte without harming the territorial sovereignty of France, of which Mayotte is now a department. On the contrary, it will benefit the local economy and employment. So I voted for it.

name: Andrej PLENKOVIĆ
text: Written. — I support the recommendation on the draft Council decision on the conclusion, on behalf of the European Union, of an agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Seysela on the access of seysela-flagged fishing vessels, waters and marine biological resources of Mayotte, which is under the legal jurisdiction of the European Union. The Council authorised the European Commission to agree an agreement with the Seyous concerning the access of Seyseli-flagged fishing vessels, the Union's waters and marine biological resources off the coast of Mayotta. The Sustainable Fisheries Partnership Agreement, which entered into force in January 2014, regulates the main relations between the Republic of Seysela and the European Union and represents the European Union's most important Agreement concerning the Indian Ocean, addressing the access of Seysela-flagged ships, waters and marine biological resources of Mayotte.  Accordingly, I am convinced that the recommendation on the Council's draft decision, with the implementation of the administrative framework, physical infrastructure, control activities and buildings of properly prescribed capacity, could be adequately implemented.

name: Salvatore Domenico POGLIESE
text: in writing. — Relations between the EU and the Republic of Seychelles in the fisheries sector are governed by the Sustainable Fisheries Partnership Agreement (APPS), which entered into force in 2003 and has been renewed twice. I would remind you that this is the most important agreement that the EU has in the Indian Ocean, and as a result the Seychelles are the EU's main partner in the region. The agreement allows vessels flying the flag of Seychelles to have access to the waters and marine biological resources of Mayotte which has the status of an outermost region of the EU. It is clear that this agreement is exceptional in nature because third-country vessels are being able to fish in European territorial waters. The reason for promoting the agreement , and that is why I am in favour, is to limit the number of Seychelles vessels fishing in Mayotte waters, in accordance with the rules of the common fisheries policy. This protects tuna stocks because of their migratory nature. I am also reassured that the mid-term review clause will be included in the agreement, which will make it possible to assess the effectiveness of the agreement three years after its entry into force.

name: Franck PROUST
text: In writing. — The change in the status of the island of Mayotte has made it possible to communitize this region where Seychellois tuna fishers are used to fishing in the waters. This agreement therefore follows a precedent, while taking into account the change in the status of the island. It is worth noting certain provisions to monitor the compliance of the activity of the parties to this agreement in its waters as well as respect for the rule of law and fundamental rights. So I'm voting for it.

name: Paulo RANGEL
text: in writing. — The partnership agreement on sustainable tuna fishing between the EU and Seychelles entered into force on 10 May 2003. This Agreement, initialled on 3 April 2014, refers to the access of Seichelenses fishing vessels to mayote waters, authorising 8 tuna vessels and 2 Seichelenses tankers to fish in Mayan waters, within 24 to 100 nautical miles. It should be noted that the territory of Mayot became an outermost region of the EU on 1 January 2014 and is currently its exclusive economic zone an integral part of EU waters. It was therefore necessary to replace the previous private agreement governing relations between the Seichelenses and Mayote fishing vessels. In terms of financial contributions, the fees paid by Seichelenses vessels are the same as those paid by European vessels in Seichelenses waters (EUR 110 per tonne of fish caught in the first year), and such charges should be used to support local fisheries in Mayot.  Because I believe that the agreement is beneficial for both parties and is also in line with the terms of the Common Fisheries Policy and the rules of the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission, I voted in favour.

name: Teresa RODRIGUEZ-RUBIO
text: in writing. - We voted in favour of this Recommendation which endorses the Agreement between the EU and the Republic of Seychelles, as it benefits both sides, is positive for the economic development of Mayotte and seychelles, and respects the rules of the Common Fisheries Policy and the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission (CAOI) on resource protection. This Agreement will allow the continuation of a traditional economic activity in that region, taking into account criteria of good management and protection of resources. It will also promote the local economy and infrastructure development of the fishing sector on the island of Mayotte and the Republic of Seychelles and strengthen good relations between the latter and the EU.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: In writing. — The European Parliament has approved an agreement between the EU and Seychelles on the access of Seychelles-flagged fishing vessels to Mayotte's marine biological resources. It is a partnership agreement that governs fisheries relations between the EU and Seychelles. This agreement came into force on 10 May 2003 and has been renewed twice since then. The agreement approved by the EP (signed on 3 April 2014) provides access to the area between 24 miles and 100 miles for 8 purse seine tuna vessels and 2 Seychelles-flagged supply vessels for a six-year period. The area of 0 to 24 miles remains reserved for local fishing in Mahorese. This agreement allows a limited number of Seychelles vessels (traditionally used to fish in the waters of Mayotte) to continue fishing in the mahorese exclusive economic zone. It should be noted that the territory of Mayotte became an ultra-peripheral region of the EU on 1 January 2014. Before the change in Mayotte's status, a private agreement governed relations between European and Seychelles fishing vessels and Mayotte.

name: Fernando RUAS
text: in writing. — On 10 May 2003 a partnership agreement between the European Union and seychelles entered into force in the field of sustainable tuna fishing. As of 1 January 2014, Mayote has become an outermost region of the EU and this access agreement was initialled on 3 April 2014 on the access of fishing vessels flying the Seychelles flag to the waters and biological resources of Mayote, which have now been managed by the EU, in accordance with Article 3 TFEU, which states that it is the union's exclusive competence to manage the eu's fisheries resources. , as well as negotiating and managing bilateral agreements concerning this territory. This new agreement allows a limited number of vessels flying the Seychelles flag and traditionally fishing in mayot waters to continue to carry out their fishing activities in the ERU of this ORs, in accordance with the rules inherent in the common fisheries policy. I voted this recommendation favourably because I consider, like the rapporteur, that the conditions inherent in this agreement are appropriate, proportionate and transparent, providing benefits for both sides.

name: Matteo SALVINI
text: in writing. - (IT) I have chosen to vote in favour because the recommendation allows compliance with the agreement with the Seychelles, allowing their vessels to fish in the waters of the outermost region of Mayotte and benefiting local shipowners residing in an area under EU jurisdiction.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: in writing. — We voted in favour of this Recommendation which endorses the Agreement between the EU and the Republic of Seychelles, as it benefits both sides, is positive for the economic development of Mayotte and seychelles, and respects the rules of the Common Fisheries Policy and the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission (CAOI) on resource protection. This Agreement will allow the continuation of a traditional economic activity in that region, taking into account criteria of good management and protection of resources. It will also promote the local economy and infrastructure development of the fishing sector on the island of Mayotte and the Republic of Seychelles and strengthen good relations between the latter and the EU.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. — This report concerns the agreement signed between the Republic of the Seychelles and the territory of Mayotte, which acceded to the status of outermost region on 1 January 2014. In doing so, fishing resources in Mayotte's exclusive economic zone became under EU competence, forcing the adapting of old fisheries contracts to the rules of the common fisheries policy. Due to the proximity between the Seychelles and Mayotte, a limited number of Seychelles boats had traditionally fished in the waters of Mayotte. The agreement allows this practice to continue, in accordance with European fishing rules. As a result, I voted in favour.

name: Remo SERNAGIOTTO
text: in writing. — (IT) In today's vote we have given our assent to the first 'access agreement' authorizing third-country vessels to fish in European waters. This will allow a limited number of vessels flying the flag of the Seychelles (8 tuna seiners and 2 support vessels) to continue fishing in Mayotte waters for a period of six years, in compliance with European rules of the common fisheries policy.  I voted in favour of this report because I believe that the agreement can benefit not only the Seychelles, but also mayotte's economic development. The fees collected for the issue of licences will enable this outermost European region to respond effectively to the sectoral needs of the island in terms of port infrastructure, landing, control and placing on the market of products.

name: Ricardo SERRÃO SANTOS
text: in writing. " This is an atypical fishing agreement. Contrary to what is customary, instead of achieving accessibility of fishing areas in third countries, in this case the European Union has its territory so that a third country can fish there. Thus, with this fisheries agreement, the European Union allows the Republic of the Seychelles to fish in Mayote, a new outermost region of Europe. The financial benefits of the initiative are transmitted to the Government of Mayote. I would like to speak to justify my choice of positive vote because it seems crucial to me that it should be noted that, despite being a positive agreement, it could still have gone further. In future fisheries agreements, it is necessary to clearly define the target species, mention the species which, in those waters, are covered by international, national or regional conservation status, and should mention what measures are taken to mitigate the possible effect on these species.

name: Davor Ivo STIER
text: Written. — I supported this AGREEMENT between the EU and the Seyseles on the access of fishing vessels sailing in Mayotte waters in line with mayotte's change in status, which became the EU's outermost region on 1 January 2014. On that day, Mayotte's current exclusive economic zone (EEC) became part of EU waters. This agreement will allow vessels flying the Seysele flag to have access to Mayotte from the date of its signature. The fees paid by Seyou economic operators to obtain fishing authorisations for highly migratory species should, in line with previous practice, be paid to Mayotte. The fee aims to enable Mayotte to develop its own management and control system and to manage fisheries and develop capacities.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: Written. - I support the Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Seyseli on the access of fishing vessels, flying the flag of the Seyseles, the waters and marine biological resources of Mayotte, which is under the legal jurisdiction of the European Union. This Agreement has already been renewed twice and was the first such document concluded by the European Union in the Indian Ocean and as such has been a pioneer in the region. Thanks to the agreement, the Mayotte area has become an external region of the Union. The common fishing policy of the Union and the Republic of Seyseli is also regulated and the exploitation of water and biological wealth is regulated. The eligibility of the agreement is also supported by the fact that it has clauses in place to protect the EU from any non-compliance. Exploitation of species that migrate naturally through the specified area is enabled. The financial effects are more favourable than in previous versions of this Agreement.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: Writing. — Agreements should be sought which promote the development of the Member States of the European Union without prejudice to their national interests.

name: Marc TARABELLA
text: In writing. — I voted in favour of Mr Cadec's proposal on the Council's decision on the conclusion, on behalf of the European Union, of the agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Seychelles on the access of Seychelles-flagged fishing vessels to the waters and marine biological resources of Mayotte, under the jurisdiction of the European Union. However, I can only regret the failure to hold a preparatory debate in the plenary session when the agenda made it easy to do so!

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: Written. — I support the recommendation on the Council's draft decision on the conclusion of the Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Seyseli on the access of Seyseli-flagged fishing vessels to the resources of Mayotte, as these are issues of sustainable fisheries but also on the protection of European waters. As an MP from a country that has encountered tuna harvesting and efficient management of natural resources to save this endangered species, I support the provisions of the Agreement which allows economic growth of both parties but also better protection of resources with regard to natural tuna migration.  I find the agreement useful because it restricts access to tuna fishing vessels and at the same time sets a time limit by which vessels will be entitled to a fishing licence, while responding positively to the Republic of Seyseli's request for fishing in European waters.

name: Ramon TREMOSA i BALCELLS
text: in writing. — Relations between the European Union and the Republic of Seychelles fisheries are governed by a partnership agreement in the field of fisheries sustainability, which respects the rules of the Common Fisheries Policy of the European Union and thereby permits greater transparency than the previous private agreement. So I am in favour. Furthermore, the development of the local economy in fisheries and processing by having to land their catches in the port of Victoria, Seychelles, is allowed.

name: Ángela VALLINA
text: in writing. — This report concerns the agreement signed between the Republic of the Seychelles and the territory of Mayotte, which acceded to the status of outermost region on 1 January 2014. In doing so, fishing resources in Mayotte's exclusive economic zone became under EU competence, forcing the adapting of old fisheries contracts to the rules of the common fisheries policy. Due to the proximity between the Seychelles and Mayotte, a limited number of Seychelles boats had traditionally fished in the waters of Mayotte. The agreement allows this practice to continue, in accordance with European fishing rules. As a result, I voted in favour.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing. — The territory of Mayoe acquired the status of an outermost region of the European Union on 1 January 2014. As a result of Mayote's exclusive economic zone (EES) it now belongs to EU waters. As the EU has exclusive competence for the conservation of resources (Article 3 TFEU), the European Union is responsible for managing fisheries resources and negotiating and managing bilateral agreements on Mayoe. In view of their proximity, the Mayote and Seychelles islands were the subject of a private agreement. This allowed a total of about 30 vessels, including eight Seychelles vessels, to fish in mayote waters, thus allowing the development of its fishing sector by paying direct fees by shipowners to the French authorities in Mayote. This agreement between the Republic of Seychelles and the European Union thus allows a limited number of Seychelles vessels to continue fishing in the Mayot EES in the view of the rules of the common fisheries policy.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: Writing. — Although this is the first agreement to give a third country fishing rights in the waters of the European Union, I have voted in favour of it. The favourable conditions for the Seychelles and Mayotte will boost the economies of both countries and improve infrastructural conditions, especially in Mayotte.

name: Jadwiga WIŚNIEWSKA
text: I would like to write to the Commission. — On 13.01.2015, a vote was held on a proposal for a Council decision on the conclusion, on behalf of the European Union, of the Agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Seychelles on access by Seychelles-flagged fishing vessels to Mayotte's waters and marine biological resources under the jurisdiction of the European Union. Given the migratory nature of tuna stocks, this agreement is strategically important and will preserve the privileged relations that the European Union maintains with the Republic of Seychelles. It is beneficial for both sides, for the economic development of Mayotte and Seychelles, and respects the principles of the common fisheries policy and the IOTC in the field of resource conservation. I voted in favour of the motion for a resolution.

name: Inês Cristina ZUBER
text: in writing. — This agreement allows seychelles-flaunder vessels to access mayot waters and their resources. The territory of Mayot acquired the status of the EU's Outermost Region in January 2014. As a result of status, the Mayot Exclusive Economic Zone is subject to the provisions of the EU Treaties. The conservation of its marine living resources under the Common Fisheries Policy is an exclusive competence of the EU.  For this reason, the existing bilateral agreement between Mayote and the Seychelles must now be re-established by the EU. Our position on the EU's competences in this area is well known – we are against it. As this report only aims to extend under the same existing agreement under the new conditions, allowing a limited number of Seychelles vessels to fish in the mayan waters migratory species, offering some counterparts aimed at supporting the sustainable development of the fisheries sector in Mayot – consisting primarily of artisanal fleet, we have nothing to do with this agreement.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: in writing. — The EU Association Treaties contain, in Article 2 therein, a clause which conditions their validity on respect for human rights. This condition is usually violated: in the case of Tunisia, from its same negotiations with ben Ali's regime. This demonstrates once again the hypocritical nature of European foreign policy, which uses this article to legitimize or withdraw its support for the signatory governments. By contrast, the economic objectives of these treaties are very clear: to deepen the liberalization and economic dependence of EU-associated States, for the benefit of European capital. This report is presented as a technical formality extending the existing Association Treaty between the EU and Tunisia to Bulgaria and Romania. A vote against would mean new discrimination with regard to the status of the other Member States. However, I cannot vote favourably on a report confirming the current Association Treaty between the EU and Tunisia.  For all this, I have decided to abstain.

name: Louis ALIOT
text: In writing. — To the extent that I have always been, as a matter of principle, against any enlargement of the European Union, I voted against this text, which is merely an adaptation of the protocols of Euro-Mediterranean agreements following the accession of Romania and Bulgaria to the European Union.

name: Martina ANDERSON
text: in writing. - I abstained in the vote on the report entitled ‘Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the EC and Tunisia to take account of the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the EU’. I did so because much of the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement is effectively a classic free-trade agreement, which imposes liberalisation and privatisation on the people of the country concerned, and about which I have serious concerns. However, although I do not favour the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement itself, it does already exist and this vote only amends it to allow for the accession of Romania and Bulgaria, which I recognise. For these reasons I abstained.

name: Pascal ARIMONT
text: Writing. — On the occasion of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union, I welcome the agreement to conclude the Protocol on the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Tunisian Republic, on the other.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: In writing. — The National Front opposes any enlargement of the European Union, which helps to transform what should only be cooperation between sovereign states into a sprawling monster devouring nations. Therefore, the National Front opposed the enlargement of the Union to Romania and Bulgaria. I therefore logically object to the consequences of this enlargement, including the agreement in this recommendation, namely the EC/Tunisia Euro-Mediterranean Agreement to take account of Bulgaria and Romania's EU accession.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. — This is a technical amendment, but given that my constituents elected me on a mandate of withdrawal from the EU it would be hypocritical for me to do anything other than vote against.

name: Jean ARTHUIS
text: In writing. "I voted in favour of this deliberation because it strengthens cooperation between the European Union and the Tunisian Republic.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: Writing. — I voted in favour of this proposal, which aims to conclude a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the European Communities and the Republic of Tunisia in order to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the EU. Key aspects of the Protocol include the accession of the new Member States to the EU-Tunisia Association Agreement and the inclusion of new official EU languages to take account of the enlargement of the EU.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: In writing. — Bulgaria and Romania are now part of the Euro-Mediterranean agreement. The aim of this agreement with Tunisia is to promote regular dialogue on policy and security. The agreement is also based on an economic, trade and financial component, including the gradual liberalisation of trade, sustainable development of the region and investment.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: In writing. — This protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean agreement establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States, on the one hand, and Tunisia on the other, must take into account the accession to the European Union of Bulgaria and Romania in the meantime. Originally signed in 1995, it aims to liberalise trade in goods, services and capital between EU Member States and Tunisia. It must also strengthen cooperation in order to "promote the development and prosperity of Tunisia and the Tunisian people". Opposed to the total liberalisation of trade, which often makes unfair competition for my country France, I have spoken out against this recommendation.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: in writing. — The EU and Tunisia signed in 1995 a Euro-Mediterranean Partnership Agreement, in force since 1998, which includes regular dialogue on policy and security, economic, trade and financial cooperation – focusing mainly on progressive trade liberalization, sustainable development of the region and investment, and social, cultural and education cooperation mainly through intercultural dialogue , control of migration, development of qualifications, promotion of labour law or equality between men and women. Bulgaria and Romania's participation in this Euro-Mediterranean Partnership Agreement with Tunisia is a natural consequence of their accession to the EU and, therefore, approval should be given to the conclusion of this Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement with Tunisia, and I voted in favour of it.

name: Lynn BOYLAN
text: in writing. — I abstained in the vote on the report entitled ‘Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the EC and Tunisia to take account of the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the EU’. I did so because much of the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement is effectively a classic free-trade agreement, which imposes liberalisation and privatisation on the people of the country concerned, and about which I have serious concerns. However, although I do not favour the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement itself, it does already exist and this vote only amends it to allow for the accession of Romania and Bulgaria, which I recognise. For these reasons I abstained.

name: Mercedes BRESSO
text: in writing. — I voted in favour of the protocol in order to permit a dialogue with Tunisia regarding the accession of new members to the EU.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: In writing. — The conclusion of a protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the European Communities aims to take into account the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union. This formal protocol is a direct result of the European Union's enlargement policy. The Euro-Mediterranean agreement will therefore be extended to Bulgaria and Romania. If I fundamentally challenge not only the Euro-Mediterranean agreement, but also the policy of enlargement of the European Union, I abstained on this vote considering that it is a matter of technical detail.

name: Daniel BUDA
text: in writing. — On 23 October 2006, the Council authorised the Commission, on behalf of the European Community and its Member States, to negotiate with Tunisia a Protocol amending the Agreements concluded between the European Community and third countries, in particular the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, of the one part, and Tunisia, of the other part, in order to take account of the accession of the new Member States , in this case Romania and Bulgaria, to the EU.   The Treaty on the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union entered into force on 1 January 2007, so the Protocol must now take into account the accession of the two countries to the EU.        I voted in favour of this recommendation primarily because the country from which I come is the subject of this protocol, and that meeting all aspects of the full integration of the country is an objective for both Romania and the European Union.

name: Gianluca BUONANNO
text: in writing. — I abstained. The vote is purely technical and calls for the Bulgarian and Romanian languages to be included in the agreement following the entry of Bulgaria and Romania into the EU.

name: Alain CADEC
text: In writing. — The European Union and Tunisia are two very important political and economic partners. The EU has always supported the interest of close cooperation with Tunisia in implementing democratic reforms and economic modernisation. With the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the EU in 2007, all international agreements, trade or other, must be extended to these new Member States via a protocol. I voted in favour of this report, which stresses the importance of adapting the European legislative framework to the structural changes taking place within the Union.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. — This agreement amends the previous protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement to take due account of the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union.

name: Aymeric CHAUPRADE
text: In writing. "I preferred to abstain on this text. Of course, this is a legal adjustment to a de facto situation since Romania and Bulgaria, as Member States, must be held to the same rights and obligations as the others. However, I was not in favour of the accession of these two countries to the European Union. The latter, by pure ideology, continues the race for enlargement beyond any principle of reality and pragmatism: the new members, as we know, are hungry for European subsidies; in these times of eurozone crisis, it was not wise to continue the policy of enlargement. When the house is burning, we don't take care of redoing the paintings. Finally, I am not in favour of the Euro-Mediterranean association agreements as a whole, since they are helping to make Europe a colander organisation, both in terms of the free movement of people and that of capital or goods. As a result, our markets and industries are subject to the often unfair competition of labour at a lower cost through the social dumping mechanism. The European Parliament, because it is supposed to represent the interests of the citizens who elected it, cannot therefore endorse such policies against the well-being of the peoples of Europe.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. — It was easy to decide to vote in favour of this protocol. This is almost automatic, given the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the EU as early as 2007. I regret, however, the delay in the process of this decision, given that the accession of these two countries took place eight years ago. I hope that the timetable for Croatia will be shorter.

name: Carlos COELHO
text: in writing. — I support Mr Brok's report adapting the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an Association between the European Communities and their Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Tunisia, of the other part, to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union. This simple act is loaded with great symbolism. When the institutions operate, the new Member States should be fully integrated. This is now the case in the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement, but it should have already occurred with regard to full integration into the Schengen area. The Council is deahering to a decision which it should have already taken, listening to unanimity which it apparently cannot obtain.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing. — (IT) I voted in favour because the association agreements concluded under the Euro-Mediterranean partnership are intended to promote interregional cooperation between the Mediterranean partner countries as a factor for peace and stability and for economic and social development. The accession of the countries of Eastern Europe, and in particular Bulgaria and Romania, to the EU has led to the need to establish new association agreements that take account of the current geopolitical and economic interests of the 'new Europe'.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. — I have voted in favour of this report that recommends giving consent to the conclusion of the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Communities and their Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Tunisia, of the other part, to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union. The Protocol will not change the nature of the Agreement itself.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. — The EU Association Treaties contain, in Article 2 therein, a clause which conditions their validity on respect for human rights. This condition is usually violated: in the case of Tunisia, from its same negotiations with ben Ali's regime. This demonstrates once again the hypocritical nature of European foreign policy, which uses this article to legitimize or withdraw its support for the signatory governments. By contrast, the economic objectives of these treaties are very clear: to deepen the liberalization and economic dependence of EU-associated States, for the benefit of European capital. This report is presented as a technical formality extending the existing Association Treaty between the EU and Tunisia to Bulgaria and Romania. A vote against would mean new discrimination with regard to the status of the other Member States. However, I cannot vote favourably on a report confirming the current Association Treaty between the EU and Tunisia.  For all this, I have decided to abstain.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. — This report is a formality in order to regularise the text of the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Communities and their Member States with the Republic of Tunisia. The slight revisions made to the text are meant to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and the Republic of Romania to the European Union. Thus, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: In writing. — The Mediterranean agreement between the European Union and Tunisia signed in 1995 was the first in a series of cooperation treaties between the two shores of the Mediterranean, constituting the Euro-Mediterranean partnership. The accession of the new EU Member States to the Euro-Mediterranean agreement must be decided through a protocol to that agreement. Since Bulgaria and Romania joined the European Union in 2007, it is normal, as members of the European Union, for these two countries to become parties to the agreement between the Union and Tunisia. For these reasons, I voted for the conclusion and adoption of this protocol.

name: Rachida DATI
text: In writing. Initiated by the Barcelona process in 1995, the Euro-Mediterranean partnership between the European Union and the countries of the southern Mediterranean has taken the form of association agreements with Mediterranean partner countries. There is a Euro-Mediterranean agreement establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States on the one hand, and the Tunisian Republic on the other. The accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union in 2007 thus requires the vote of a protocol to this agreement, in order to take account of the accession of these two Member States.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: In writing. — The National Front opposes any enlargement of the European Union, which helps to transform what should only be cooperation between sovereign states into a sprawling monster devouring nations. Therefore, the National Front opposed the enlargement of the Union to Romania and Bulgaria. I therefore logically object to the consequences of this enlargement, including the agreement in this recommendation, namely the EC/Tunisia Euro-Mediterranean Agreement to take account of Bulgaria and Romania's EU accession.

name: Pablo ECHENIQUE
text: in writing. — We abstained in the vote on Euromed. While the Protocol to be adopted is a formal procedure without further practical consequences, we wanted to express our disagreement with the EU's policy towards Tunisia. For example, with the loan agreed last year, which was granted with conditions similar to those usually put by the IMF, and with the mobility agreement, which opens the way to admission agreements that delight the management of migration flows in the African country.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: Writing. — There is a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the EU and Tunisia. The Council requests that the accession of Bulgaria and Romania be taken into account in the Protocol. All Member States must participate equally in European institutions and treaties.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. — The accession of Romania and Bulgaria to the EU (in 2007) required the conclusion of a Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement to extend to these two countries the scope of the creation of a free trade area. The conclusion of this Protocol is not, however, a neutral act, as it extends the scope, increasing the territory and population concerned. It is an agreement that will not fail to seriously affect Tunisia's ability to take sovereign management measures of its economy, allowing large economic groups on both sides freedom of establishment without added costs, benefiting them to the detriment of SMEs, small and medium-sized farmers and family farming and small-scale fishing. Its effects on increased competition and the pressure exerted on workers to reduce wages, lower export costs, lower prices to the final consumer are well known to destroy local production, once again to increase them when it detains the hegemony of production and/or trade, without benefit to quality and food security and generating an even greater destruction of the environment.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. — This purely technical protocol calls for the Bulgarian and Romanian languages to be included in the agreement following the entry of Bulgaria and Romania into the EU. However, I do not fully support the protocol because it keeps the current trade agreement between Tunisia and the EU unchanged.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: Writing. — I am voting against the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the EC and Tunisia to take account of the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the EU, as: (a) economic association agreements with third countries undermine the economic stability of Europe and the Member States and (b) financial assistance to third countries through trade to them serves only the interests of economically powerful States.

name: Francisco de Paula GAMBUS MILLET
text: in writing. — I voted in favour of the recommendation considering that it represents the inclusion of Bulgaria and Romania in the existing collaboration between the EU and the southern and eastern shore of the Mediterranean, a strategic and fundamental area for the interests of the EU. Further strengthening Euro-Mediterranean dialogue is essential for the sake of greater collaboration in the economic, social and democratic development of the EU's neighbouring countries, where I hope that Bulgaria and Romania will play an important role.

name: Nathan GILL
text: in writing. — Association agreements are a half-way house to full EU membership. However, as the EU has not been able to get its own house in order as of yet, with mass unemployment and a plummeting euro, further expansionism is folly.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. - I voted in favour of this report as it essentially concerns a purely technical adaptation of the text of the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Communities and their Member States and the Republic of Tunisia, made to reflect the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. — We abstained in the vote on Euromed. While the Protocol to be adopted is a formal procedure without further practical consequences, we wanted to express our disagreement with the EU's policy towards Tunisia. For example, with the loan agreed last year, which was granted with conditions similar to those usually put by the IMF, and with the mobility agreement, which opens the way to admission agreements that delight the management of migration flows in the African country.

name: Pablo IGLESIAS
text: in writing. - We abstained in the vote on Euromed. While the protocol to be adopted is a formal process without further practical consequences, we wanted to express our disagreement with the EU's policy towards Tunisia. For example, with the loan agreed last year, which was granted with conditions similar to those usually put by the IMF, and with the mobility agreement that opens the way to admission agreements that delight the management of migration flows in the African country.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. — I voted to recommend the draft Decision of the Council on the conclusion, on behalf of the European Union and its Member States, of the protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Tunisia, on the other, in order to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union. My vote of support is related to the fact that there is a Euro-Mediterranean Agreement concerning the relations between the Member States of the European Union and the Republic of Tunisia, and since the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania has created the need to amend and amend this Agreement, I considered it necessary to support this recommendation.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. — I supported the report on the conclusion of a protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean agreement between the European Communities and their Member States on the one hand, and Tunisia on the other, to take account of the accession to the Union of Bulgaria and Romania. As this agreement was concluded before the EU's enlargement to Bulgaria and Romania, before 1 January 2007, it is therefore necessary to add to the Euro-Mediterranean agreement a new protocol to take account of the accession of these two Member States to the original agreement.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. — I supported concluding the protocol, as it establishes the rules enabling Tunisia to participate in certain Union programmes.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. - (IT) I am voting in favour of President Elmar Brok's report because it supports the adoption of an agreement that I believe is necessary between the EC and Tunisia. The participation by new members of the European Union in the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement is formalised by means of a protocol to the Council agreement, on behalf of the European Union, signed with the country concerned, which, in this case, is Represented by Tunisia.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. — The EU Association Treaties contain, in Article 2 therein, a clause which conditions their validity on respect for human rights. This condition is usually violated: in the case of Tunisia, from its same negotiations with ben Ali's regime. This demonstrates once again the hypocritical nature of European foreign policy, which uses this article to legitimize or withdraw its support for the signatory governments. By contrast, the economic objectives of these treaties are very clear: to deepen the liberalization and economic dependence of EU-associated States, for the benefit of European capital. This report is presented as a technical formality extending the existing Association Treaty between the EU and Tunisia to Bulgaria and Romania. A vote against would mean new discrimination with regard to the status of the other Member States. However, I cannot vote favourably on a report confirming the current Association Treaty between the EU and Tunisia.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: in writing. — I am voting in favour of this draft resolution for the accession of the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement, which will establish a partnership between the European Communities and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Tunisia, on the other, to take account of the accession to the European Union of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: Written. — On 29 September 2014, the Council of the European Union adopted a decision on the signing and provisional application of the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the European Community and its Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Tunisia, on the other, in order to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union.  Bulgaria and Romania joined the European Union in 2007. The accession of the new members of the European Union to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement should be agreed in accordance with the Protocol of the Agreement. The consent of the European Parliament is a mandatory component in the completion of the process of ratification of the Additional Protocol, so I supported this report as it does not change the nature of the Agreement and preserves the integrity of the internal market.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: Writing. - I voted in favour. This Decision is purely protocol-based, since it relates to the last enlargement of the European Union with the accession of Bulgaria and Romania, with a view to the entry of the names of these countries into the text of the Treaty and extending the treaty to those countries.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: Writing. — I abstained from voting on the Recommendation because I consider that the conclusion of this Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the European Community and its Member States and the Republic of Tunisia in order to take account of the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union is not beneficial to the interests of Greek fishermen who have already been impoverished by the policies of the Memorandum.

name: David MARTIN
text: in writing. — I supported this report on an agreement between the European Union and the Republic of Tunisia to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. — Favourable to the Agreement of the EC-Tunisia Euro-Mediterranean Protocol establishing an association between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Tunisia, of the other part, to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union

name: Barbara MATERA
text: in writing. — Participation by new members of the European Union in the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement is formalized by means of a protocol to the agreement which the Council, on behalf of the European Union, signs with the country concerned, in this case Tunisia. I supported the Brok report with my vote in favour, because it supports the adoption of an agreement which, in my opinion, is absolutely necessary.

name: Georg MAYER
text: Writing. — Since the content of MEP Brok's recommendation was very poor, I had to abstain from voting.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. — The Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Communities and their Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Tunisia, of the other part, is adopted in order to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union. Hence my vote in favour.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. — I voted in favour of this recommendation because it is due time for Bulgaria and Romania to benefit from the full range of agreements and associations that the EU is part of. Tunisia is a key player in the Mediterranean and Maghreb regions, Bulgaria and Romania should therefore have access to the opportunities brought by this agreement.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: In writing. I welcome the European Parliament's approval of the protocol to include Bulgaria and Romania in the EC/Tunisia Euro-Mediterranean Agreement signed on 17 July 1995 between the European Communities and their Member States on the one hand and the Tunisian Republic on the other. This association agreement aims to provide a framework for political dialogue between the parties and to set the conditions for the gradual liberalisation of trade in goods, services and capital. It is vital that Parliament participates in the approval of this type of agreement which allows the European Union to speak with one voice in the political dialogue with its neighbours.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. — I voted in favour of the draft Council decision giving consent for the inclusion of a protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Communities and their Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Tunisia, of the other part, to take account of the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union.

name: Claude MORAES
text: in writing. — I voted in favour of the draft recommendation as it gives the European Parliament’s consent to the conclusion of the Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the EC and Tunisia, establishing rules enabling the Republic of Tunisia to participate in certain Union programmes.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. — I voted in favour of this purely technical text which adapts the Euro-Mediterranean agreement with Tunisia to take account of the EU accession of Bulgaria and Romania.

name: Alessandra MUSSOLINI
text: in writing. — (IT) I voted in favour of the protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and the Republic of Tunisia, of the other part, to take account of the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union which, as new members, need this protocol in order to be a member.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. — I voted for this protocol as Romania supports the existing cooperation under the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the European Commission and Tunisia. Tunisia is a country in the process of democratisation, and Romania's experience can be used by the European Union to support the democratic transition in that country.

name: Liadh NÍ RIADA
text: in writing. - I voted Abstention on the report "Protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement between the EC and Tunisia to take account of the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the EU". I did so because much of the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement is affectively a classic free trade agreement which imposes liberalisation and privatisation on the people of that country and which I have serious concerns about.  However although I do not favour the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement itself, it does already exist and this vote only amends it to allow for the accession of Romania and Bulgaria, which I recognise. For these reasons I voted abstention.

name: Younous OMARJEE
text: In writing. Although this is only a technical revision of a 1995 agreement, I do not believe that the entire free trade orientation of this partnership is favourable to Tunisia, which has seen a considerable increase in its debt as a result of the IMF loans following the adoption of the agreement with the EU.

name: Urmas PAET
text: Writing. — I supported the proposal because I consider it important to work with Tunisia in the light of the enlargement of the EU and the changes in Tunisia.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. — (IT) In view of the work carried out by the rapporteur and the positions discussed, I have every confidence in what has been voted on.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: In writing. "I am strongly opposed to the Euro-Mediterranean agreement which does not allow for healthy relations with the Mediterranean countries. These agreements should also be bilateral between states wishing to develop their relations and not regulated by a supranational body. So I voted against extending the protocol.

name: Andrej PLENKOVIĆ
text: Written. — I supported the protocol to the Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States, on the one hand, and the Republic of Tunisia, on the other, which would take into account the accession of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union, so that an appropriate framework for north-south political dialogue as a factor of peace, stability and economic and social development is effectively provided. The Protocol will serve as the basis for the gradual liberalisation of trade in the Mediterranean area, and lay down the conditions for economic, social and cultural cooperation between the EU and the partner country. Political, economic and social partnership is based on the principles of reciprocity, solidarity and cooperation, as the goal of global Mediterranean policy is mutual understanding, cooperation, joint initiative, intellectual dialogue, improvement of trade and financial decisions, migration control, development of qualifications, etc.

name: Salvatore Domenico POGLIESE
text: in writing. — In this case, the conclusion of the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the EU and its Member States and the Republic of Tunisia is an obligatory step taking into account the subsequent accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the European Union (accession in 2007). In addition, the recommendation of Parliament's Committee on Foreign Affairs was favourable to the proposal for a Council decision.

name: Franck PROUST
